subject: Re: new members
msgSnippet: True, that s the main reason why I learned Shavian and Quikscript. For Shavian I made my own transliteration: http://www.ouweherder.nl/shaviannl.doc
messageBody:
True, that's the main reason why I learned Shavian and Quikscript. For
Shavian I made my own transliteration:

http://www.ouweherder.nl/shaviannl.doc

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Paul Vandenbrink"
<pvandenbrink11@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Ramse
> Dutch Speakers should appreciate the Read or the Shavian
> Alphabet even more than Native English Speakers.
> Dutch is a Germanic Language like English and so it also does not
> fit into the Roman Alphabet very well.
> They do handle the vowel letters better in Dutch because of
> 1940 spelling reform.
> We got rid of Roman Numbers, but we still use the Roman
> Alphabet long after Latin became a dead language.
> Regards, Paul van den Brink
> ________________attached_____________________
> >From: "ramsesoudt" <tommie22@...>
> >Reply-To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> >To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: new members
> >Date: Thu, 24 Aug 2006 12:59:34 -0000
> >
> >Currently I'm learning some friends the Dutch version of Shavian. But
> >as they're no champs in speaking or writing English, and as I learn
> >them Shavian this group wouldn't be the best place for them to hang
> >around.
> >
> >--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "steveb_667" <sbartok1632@>
> >wrote:
> > >
> > > Perhaps an influx of new members denotes some advertising of
> > > Quikscript / Shavian / Reformed Spelling that we have not been aware
> > > of. I recall that the National Spelling Bee took place a little
> >while
> > > ago & that there was an Associated Press article concerning the
> > > history of spelling reform. However, I am doubtful that this one
> > > article alone would draw so many people in.
> > >
> > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "C. Paige Gabhart"
> > > <pgabhart@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > This is probably a record: the group has picked up 10 new
> >members in
> > > > the last 15 days. We now have 289 members. I keep thinking we
> >will
> > > > break 300, but every time we get close, I find there are several
> > > members
> > > > whose eemails are bouncing, and I delete them. If you change
> >your
> > > > eemail, don't forget to update your Yahoo eemail so you will
> > > continue to
> > > > get group eemails and know what is happening here.
> > > >
> > > > Tell a friend or two who has the intellectual curiosity to be
> > > excited by
> > > > QS, and we can break that 300 mark easily.
> > > >
> > > > Welcome to our new members: spugnoid, pvandenbrink11, kfs111,
> >rsmalln,
> > > > lebusy, ccradu, raveena346, tim_rice09, futhark2002, and
> >icalway2000.
> > > > If you have special talents (such as programming or other
> >computer
> > > > knowledge) that could help spread the word about QS and improve
> >the
> > > > site, please don't lurk in the background. We can use your help.
> > > Thanks.
> > > >
> > > > Paige
> > > >
> > >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
> _________________________________________________________________
